name: The Red Fox Multiple Choice Quiz | Carnivores | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following field markings is most helpful in identifying a red fox?
questions.explanation:
White tail tip.

	All red foxes, no matter the color variant, have the white tail tip. Gray foxes have a black tail tip and a black stripe on the back. All foxes have large, pointed ears!

questions.text: Which of the following color patterns is not found in wild red foxes?
questions.explanation:
White.

	Arctic foxes are white. The cross fox is a brownish color with a black cross over the back and shoulders.

questions.text: The red fox is not native to the United States, but was imported from England by foxhunters..
questions.explanation:
False.

	Although the foxhunters did import foxes, the red fox was already native.

questions.text: The red fox is not native to Australia, but was imported from England by foxhunters.
questions.explanation:
True.

	It was also hoped that the imported fox would help control the also-imported rabbit. It didn't work.

questions.text: What is the name of the Japanese fox spirit that can change at will from fox to human?
questions.explanation:
Kitsune.

	The kitsune was usually female, and often attempted to seduce a human male.

questions.text: True or false. Mounted foxhunts, with riders and hounds chasing after a fox, are illegal in the United States.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Unfortunately, this barbaric 'sport' is also found in the US, especially in the East.

questions.text: In the United States, in what month do red foxes usually mate?
questions.explanation:
February.

	The kits are born mostly in April, and become independent around August.

questions.text: Do male red foxes help care for their young?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	They are solicitous parents, bringing food to mom and kits.

questions.text: What is a female red fox called?
questions.explanation:
Vixen & A vixen.

	A male fox is usually called a dog or a dog fox. In England, he may be referred to as a "tod."

questions.text: This fox starred in a series of fables written over 800 years ago that satirized the French government.
questions.explanation:
Reynard.

	Reynard was the folk hero of these tales, against the government of swine and wolves.
